about_the_game:
The Penn Central – it was a 20,000-mile railroad goliath created in the late 1960s through the merger of great rivals New York Central and Pennsylvania, plus the famed New Haven. Penn Central endured a troubled existence until rolled into Conrail in 1976, but nonetheless the giant railroad hosted an extraordinary variety of operations and called upon one of the largest and most diverse diesel locomotive rosters in history. And now, Penn Central railroading comes to Train Simulator – with Penn Central Pack 01 from acclaimed High Iron Simulations!

Penn Central Pack 01 delivers the realistic experiences and challenges of railroading in the late 1960s and early 1970, as first- and second-generation diesels haul passengers and handle tonnage on one of Train Simulator’s classic routes – the double-tracked and bustling ex-New Haven Springfield Line in New England.

Penn Central Pack 01 includes six types of diesel locomotives, in multiple variations and a variety of authentic Penn Central and Pennsylvania Railroad liveries:

  • The classic streamlined Electro-Motive FL9, created by EMD for the New Haven, is featured in Penn Central and New Haven liveries and the model reflects the FL9s “as built” 1960s configuration and details.
  • Another first-generation classic, the Alco FA (FA1 and FB2) is featured in cab and booster configuration and Penn Central livery.
  • The landmark Electro-Motive GP9 is included in multiple Penn Central and Pennsylvania Railroad liveries and with a range of detail variations. Liveries include PRR early and late liveries and standard and “red P” PC schemes.
  • The unique Electro-Motive cabless GP9B is included in Penn Central and Pennsylvania Railroad liveries.
  • The potent, six-axle, second-generation Electro-Motive SD35 is provided in Penn Central livery
  • The veteran workhorse Electro-Motive SW1200 diesel switcher is featured in Penn Central livery.

Each of the locomotives in Penn Central Pack 01 feature the advanced and authentic air braking systems as developed by Mike Rennie of Smokebox.

Joining the diverse motive power in Penn Central Pack 01 is a selection of freight rolling stock, including Penn Central’s noted Nb5 (ex-PRR) and NE-5 (ex-NYNH&H) cabooses, Penn Central (ex-NYNH&H) streamlined parlor-baggage-lounge and coach, and a selection of nine types of period-authentic freight rolling stock in multiple liveries and variations, including Penn Central, New York Central, Pennsylvania, and New Haven liveries. And Penn Central Pack 01 will put you right to work with ten realistic career scenarios on the busy and now visually enhanced Train Simulator Springfield Line: Springfield – New Haven route, handling passenger, main line freight, local, and switching duties across the length of the line.

Note: The locomotives and equipment of Penn Central Pack 01 can be used on a variety of Train Simulator routes. The included scenarios require the Springfield Line: Springfield – New Haven Route Add-On (route available separately).

Climb aboard and take the throttle of Penn Central’s memorable and diverse diesel motive power and relive challenging 1960s and 1970s railroading – with High Iron Simulation’s Penn Central Pack 01 for Train Simulator!

Included Scenarios


Ten realistic and challenging career scenarios representing Penn Central operations of the late 1960s and early 1970s are included, putting you at the throttle of Penn Central motive power for passenger, mainline freight, local, and switching operations on the Train Simulator Springfield Line: Springfield – New Haven Route Add-On. The scenarios are closely based upon actual Penn Central operations and train symbols of the era.

  • [PC 1.01] Penn Central SN-4, Pt. 1
  • [PC 1.02] Penn Central SN-4, Pt. 2
  • [PC 1.03] Thanksgiving Travelers, Pt. 1
  • [PC 1.04] Thanksgiving Travelers, Pt. 2
  • [PC 1.05] Working the Weathersfield
  • [PC 1.06] B&A Shuffle
  • [PC 1.07] Penn Central TV-7
  • [PC 1.08] On The Suffield Industrial
  • [PC 1.09] Penn Central NX-25 Rock Haul
  • [PC 1.10] Penn Central M-7 Manifest

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • Penn Central and New Haven Electro-Motive FL9 diesel locomotives
  • Penn Central Electro-Motive SD35 diesel locomotive
  • Penn Central Alco FA1 and FB2 diesel locomotives
  • Penn Central and Pennsylvania Railroad Electro-Motive GP9 in multiple livery and detail variations
  • Penn Central and Pennsylvania Railroad Electro-Motive GP9B
  • Penn Central Electro-Motive SW1200 diesel locomotive
  • Penn Central Nb5 (ex-PRR) and NE-5 (ex-NYNH&H) cabooses
  • Penn Central (ex-NYNH&H) streamlined parlor-baggage-lounge and coach
  • Nine types of period-authentic freight rolling stock in multiple liveries and variations. including Penn Central, New York Central, Pennsylvania, and New Haven liveries
  • Ten realistic and challenging career scenarios for use on the Springfield Line: Springfield – New Haven Route
  • Quick Drive compatible
  • Download size: 731.5MB

Please note that the Penn Central Pack 01 and Springfield Line are highly detailed Add-Ons, and you may be required to adjust your in-game settings to get the best possible experience. The use of 64-bit Train Simulator is also recommended.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i5 4690 3.50 GHz Quad Core or AMD Ryzen 7 1700 3.80 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM (maximum possible under 32-bit Windows)/16 GB or Better (For 64-bit Windows)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon RX 480 with 4 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: High Performance SSD Recommended with 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
